channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: After Kennedy’s Endorsement of Trump, the Two Signal a New Alliance
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., who suspended his independent presidential bid earlier on Friday, was embraced by Donald J. Trump at a rally in Arizona. But th...

item.title: Knife Attack in Germany Kills at Least 3 at Solingen Festival
item.description: The attack took place in Solingen during a celebration of the 650th anniversary of the city’s founding. Eight people were wounded.

item.title: Hydrogen cars, London pubs, and Manchester United: 71-year-old billionaire Sir Jim Ratcliffe is in a race to secure his legacy
item.description: Jim Ratcliffe's purchases may help him be remembered beyond his fortune from a $52 billion petrocchemicals giant.

item.title: After a Big Week for Democrats, One Good Day for Trump
item.description: Former President Donald J. Trump talked policy in Las Vegas and seemed almost chipper. In Arizona, he reveled in the endorsement of a former campaign ...

item.title: In Lebanese Refugee Community, People See Hope in Hamas
item.description: In Ein al-Hilweh, Lebanon, long mired in poverty and despair, Hamas recruitment is up and the downtrodden air has given way to defiance and celebratio...

item.title: The ‘Viking Code’ leadership of Nicolai Tangen, a $1.7T wealth fund CEO unafraid to lock horns with Elon Musk
item.description: The head of Norway's sovereign wealth fund demonstrates that individual drive and community spirit can build a powerful symbiosis for change.

item.title: Wild Boars Are Wreaking Havoc in Scotland’s Countryside
item.description: Local residents say the animals are roaming the roads and hills around the lake, tearing up lawns and terrorizing sheep.

item.title: Bus in Cambodia Is a Mobile Museum of Khmer Rouge Crimes
item.description: Most people in Cambodia are under 30, born long after the horrific rule of the Khmer Rouge. A bus is touring the country to make sure it’s not forgott...

item.title: Meta blocked an Iranian hacking network posing as tech support from Microsoft and Google
item.description: Hackers tried to target the WhatsApp accounts of political staffers tied to Donald Trump and Joe Biden.

item.title: Bus in Cambodia Is a Mobile Museum of Khmer Rouge Crimes
item.description: Most people in Cambodia are under 30, born long after the horrific rule of the Khmer Rouge. A bus is touring the country to make sure it’s not forgott...

item.title: Wild Boars Are Wreaking Havoc in Scotland’s Countryside
item.description: Local residents say the animals are roaming the roads and hills around the lake, tearing up lawns and terrorizing sheep.

item.title: Apple to unveil new iPhones and big upgrades to wearables on Sept. 10
item.description: The unveiling will be followed by the phones going on sale Sept. 20, in line with Apple’s typical approach in recent years.

item.title: 7-Eleven Is a Hard Target for Couche-Tard to Land in Takeover Bid
item.description: Convenience stores are a part of the country’s culture, meaning that the foreign buyout bid for 7-Eleven, the largest chain, could be a hard sell in J...

item.title: Police Investigate Deadly Knife Attack in Western Germany
item.description: The attack took place in a central square in Solingen, Germany, during a festival celebrating the town’s 650th anniversary.

item.title: Here’s what to do before the Fed cuts rates—’you want to jump on that now’
item.description: “There is not a benefit to waiting because interest rates are going to be moving lower,” Bankrate's Greg McBride said.
